title: Killibinbin 2015 Secrets Red (Langhorne Creek)
description: Lovers of Cabernet's greener side will enjoy the plentiful notes of green bell pepper and chili flakes on prominent display in this wine. There's also a slightly charred wood character amidst supple black cherries. The palate comes with peppery spice, leathery, taut tannins and an earthy spine. There's an oaky touch at the end, but overall this is a solid wine.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Piesporter Michelsberg Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pristine grapefruit, yellow peach and fresh apricot flavors abound in this honeyed, intensely fruity Riesling. It's sweet on the palate but balanced by spine tingling acidity and a touch of saffron on the finish. An excellent value Auslese to enjoy now–2025.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Piesporter Michelsberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose on this medium-sweet Riesling is initially smoky and earthy with hints of lemon and lime peel. The palate, by contrast, is buoyantly fruity, offering loads of sweet yellow peach and apricot nectar. A juicy, easy-drinking wine but elevated by a touch of minerality on the finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Love That Red 2015 Seattle Slew Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Char, toast and dark chocolate barrel aromas are out front, with herb and cherry lurking underneath. Full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. The wood influence is heavy, but there's enough fruit to largely stand up to it.

title: Maxville 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: There is a considerable amount of Petite Sirah (11%) blended within this wine, which helps emphasize its big power and concentration. Earth, soy, currant, cedar and graphite accent a core of juicy blackberry and chocolate-covered cherry.

title: Moët & Chandon NV Brut Impérial  (Champagne)
description: Well balanced, this Champagne, even with its enormous production, remains a benchmark and is always enjoyable. In this bottling, ripe white fruit is cut with citrus, with an edge of toastiness that gives complexity. Drink now.

title: Oregon Territory 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Once again this budget label from Paul O'Brien offers exceptional value. Barrel aged for a year in 25% new French oak, it includes 20% Willamette Valley grapes, with the rest from the Umpqua Valley. A portion of whole clusters were included, and the fermentation was done in both concrete and French oak foudres. Some flavors of earth and stem come through, and a certain astringency from the concrete, along with brambly black cherry fruit and chewy tannins.

title: Osmote 2017 Chardonnay (Cayuga Lake)
description: Bright, zesty aromas of lemon zest, crushed stone and melon meld with a delicate white blossom undertone is this unoaked Chardonnay. Juicy and succulent yet pillowy in feel, the palate offers a broad impression of fruit balanced by honed acidity.

title: Pambrun 2015 Chrysologue Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This inaugural release is a blend of 59% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Cabernet Franc and 17% Merlot, with the fruit coming from Seven Hills, Summit View and Waliser vineyards. Seeing just 35% new French oak, the emphasis is squarely on the fruit. Aromas of raspberry jam, blueberry compote, black currant and spice give way to fruit flavors that show elegance, delicacy and length. It's a pretty take on these varieties and the valley.

title: Panther Creek 2016 Kalita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is a solid wine, with a chunky mouthfeel. Firm flavors are anchored in cherries and chocolate (from 17 months spent in 40% new French oak). This is a full-bodied wine, which incorporates some herbal notes and finishes with tannins that leave a taste of green tea.

title: Pasquale Pelissero 2015 Cascina Crosa  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of violet, leather and truffle lead the nose. On the chewy palate, firm tannins accompany ripe Marasca cherry, clove and licorice. Drink after 2021.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Silex  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This young wine is still full of crisp fresh fruits. The texture is tight, mineral from the flint soil and nervy. Drink from 2020.

title: Pflüger 2017 Blanc de Noir Trocken Rosé (Pfalz)
description: Firm tannic structure and brisk acidity lend a bold structural character to this dusky, onion skin-hued rosé. Flavors of raspberry and dried strawberry are slightly savory and muted, making the wine an elegant companion to poultry or pork, even in the fall months.

title: Philippe Fontaine 2012 Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine, rich in white fruits, generous acidity and with a good balance. It has weight and intensity, the fruitiness partnered by acidity and touches of spice and minerality. Still young, the wine emphasizes fresh fruit, but is ready to drink.

title: Planeta 2014 Maroccoli Syrah (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with aromas of dark berry, sandalwood and espresso. The full-bodied, spicy palate offers blackberry jam, black pepper, cinnamon and clove alongside supple tannins.

title: Planeta 2016  Cerasuolo di Vittoria
description: This lively blend of 60% Nero d'Avola and 40% Frappato opens with aromas of red berry, tilled soil and dark spice. The bright, enjoyable palate offers ripe strawberry, crushed blackberry and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Pommery NV Brut Rosé Royal  (Champagne)
description: This attractively fruity, dry rosé has red-currant flavors and a zesty, mineral texture. It is an attractive, crisp wine with plenty of fruitiness, a taut texture and immediate drinkability.

title: Prinsi 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: Pressed violet, herb and camphor aromas shape the nose. The chewy palate delivers raspberry, black cherry and a hint of star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.

title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Firmly tannic with its black fruits still shyly in the background, this wine is darkly structured and complex. Its dark, spicy character is given richness by the ripe berry flavors. Drink the wine from 2027.

title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2016 Etincelle  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from old vines planted on flinty soil. The terroir gives a strongly mineral edge to the crisp, ripe white fruits. It has a rich character, the creamed-apple flavors edged with a touch of apricot. The wine is ready to drink.
